name: MediumDoseICSFormoterolPreparations
title: Medium Dose ICS Formoterol Preparations
publisher: NHLBI Implementation Science and Health Care Innovation Steward
purpose:
(Clinical Focus: This valueset contains oral inhaled corticosteroid preparations in combination with formoterol that are used for medium-dose single maintenance and reliever therapy (SMART) in asthmatic adults and children at least 4 years old.),(Data Element Scope: FHIR 
MedicationStatement.medicationCodeableConcept, MedicationRequest.medicationCodeableConcept),(Inclusion Criteria: Includes oral ICS-formoterol preparations that might reasonably be used to treat asthmatic children age 4+ years and adults with daily and PRN combination medium-dose ICS-formoterol as per Step 4 in the NHLBI NAEPP 2020 Focused Updates to the Asthma Management Guidelines. The medium-dose range refers to the ICS component as per the NHLBI NAEPP EPR3 Guidelines for the Diagnosis and Management of Asthma (2007).  Maintenance ICS ranges are different for age 12+ yrs vs. younger asthmatics, but medium-dose ranges are easily satisfied with the included preparations, which include formoterol in combination with budesonide 160 mcg/actuation (0.16 mg/actuation) and formoterol in combination with mometasone 200 mcg/actuation (0.2 mg/actuation).),(Exclusion Criteria: Excludes withdrawn preparations and retired codes (although they may still be available from pharmacies until supplies are exhausted); excludes low-dose oral ICS-formoterol preparations that are less likely to be used to treat asthmatics age 4+ in the medium-dose ranges as per the NHLBI NAEPP EPR3 Guidelines for the Diagnosis and Management of Asthma (2007).)
